channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo

item.description: Large technology companies are investing billions of dollars in nuclear energy as an emissions-free source of electricity for artificial intelligence ...

item.title: Plastics Are Turning Up in Dolphin Breath
item.description: Researchers studying bottlenose dolphins found polyester and other plastics in every animal they tested.

item.title: Substitute Teacher Reenacted George Floyd Murder at Minnesota High School
item.description: Students said the teacher, who claimed to be a police officer, also said “police brutality isn’t real.”

item.title: A Top Chess Player Is Disqualified After a Phone Is Found in a Bathroom Stall
item.description: Kirill Shevchenko, a grandmaster who represents Romania, has been accused of getting assistance from a computer in the middle of games.

item.title: Israeli Strike Hits Lebanese Municipal Building, Killing Mayor

item.title: IUDs and Breast Cancer Risk: What to Know
item.description: A new study adds to the evidence on hormonal contraceptives and breast cancer. But experts stressed the overall risk remains low.

item.title: Coinbase shares up 27% in October as Bitcoin rallies to $68,000
item.description: Coinbase shares break $210 as crypto fans hail “Uptober.”

item.title: 4 tips to live a longer and healthier life
item.description: Debra Whitman, executive VP and chief public policy officer at AARP, has no shortage of advice for improving your health and life span.

item.title: Top AI leaders say they don’t want women to get left behind in the tech revolution
item.description: Tech executives at Accenture, Salesforce, and Bloomberg Beta say women need to become AI users to reduce bias.

item.title: Top finance chiefs reveal how the role of the CFO has transformed, where the financial foundation is ‘just the cost of entry’
item.description: Finance chiefs at Instacart, Siemens Energy, Toast, and e.l.f. Beauty explain the work of a modern CFO.
